item.title: Pothole opened up right on the junction of Yorkland Ave, 26th January
item.description:
Pothole has gradually been getting worse at the junction of Yorkland Ave & Sutherland Ave. As cars are turning out of Yorkland they are hitting the pothole and moving out into the oncoming traffic. this is now dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sutherland Avenue, Blackfen, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Furniture, glass, 26th January
item.description:
I have been I this property since December and every morning when I wake up soemthing new has been added, I have spoken to the neighbours and they are having the same issue. Yesterday went outside the footpath is blocked I have a new born baby so had to walk in the road with the buggy, then today the wheel of my buggy has glass in it and is now not fit for use until I replace the wheel. There is all smashed glass from a cabinet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Valmar Road, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped paint, 26th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Downhills Park Road, West Green, Greater London

item.title: Drain blocked and constantly overflowing onto pavement, 26th January
item.description:
Drain blocked by leaves and fallen debris from corner tree. All debris needs to be removed from the gutter as it gets compacted by parked cars and forms a thick mud which then blocks the drain which is completely blocked. It overflows onto the pavement too causing hazards for my elderly neighbours.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wakefield Road, New Southgate, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large hole opening up in road surface - possible subsidence, 26th January
item.description:
Location is near Blackfen Motorist Centre. Hole is getting worse (larger & deeper) than a few months ago. Vehicles are swerving into oncoming traffic to avoid it. The edges are tearing up & it is going to get bigger very quickly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 286, Blackfen Road, Blackfen, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Nappies and personal waste dumped in bin that is now overflowing, 26th January
item.description:
This bin was by the bus stop just down by 27/29 Marlow Road, so it should be moved back there. Someone moved it and now it is being used to dump personal rubbish in, which attracts foxes and vermin. Please can it be returned to the correct place and also cleaned up. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Marlow Road, Anerley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
